ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, e Ssé gɔɔn mɔɔn menò ngie:
en: Then God spoke all these words:

ngiemboon: Aa mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé jù, mèŋ zɔ la fó tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò, á ndá nkwɔɔn, ńkẅile gú.
en: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the place of slavery.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńguʼte tsɔ́ messé, ɔ̀ gẅiin léguʼte pɔ́ ndàʼ wɔ́ɔn.
en: Do not have other gods besides me.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńkwóon tútú ńdɔg ńgÿo ssé. Á tútú gẅie à sẅé tsɔ́ mmó gie áa tÿǒ lefaŋ, kà gie áa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́ɔ, kà gie áa tsɛ̀ɛ mentse nzème ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́ɔ.
en: Do not make an idol   for yourself, whether in the shape of anything in the heavens above or on the earth below or in the waters under the earth.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńŋwɔ́ʼ nnɛ́ mvfò sɛ̌ shúm ŋwɛ́, te láʼ ńguʼte wɔ́b; ńtí nue mèŋ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé jù, n gee Ssé gie e kwɔ́ʼɔ lóŋ. N jÿɔ́gɔ kɔ̌ʼ pʉ̀a pie é fʉa nò, ńgíŋe ńjÿɔ́gɔ kɔ̌ʼ penkʉ́ pʉ̀a pie é pʉa wɔ́ɔn tà ńgʉa ńkúu na mejwoŋó mbɔ́ɔntè yétá mbɔɔ na mejwoŋó mbɔ́ɔntè lekùɔ.
en: Do not bow in worship to them, and do not serve them; for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God,   bringing the consequences of the fathers’ iniquity on the children to the third and fourth generations  # 20:5 Nm 14:18; Ps 79:8; Jr 32:18 of those who hate me,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgʉa na pʉ̀a pie é kwoŋo wɔ́ɔn, ḿbiŋ ńgiŋ páʼ membʉ̌ mɔ́ɔn ne ńzɛ́te, mbà n gẅiin pyennɛ́ nzèm pɔ́b tà ńgʉa ńkúu na mejwoŋó mbɔ́ɔntè tàʼ ntsáʼ.
en: but showing faithful love to a thousand generations of those who love me and keep my commands.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńtóŋ lezíŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé jù lé fʉ̀te: ńtí nue mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé jù, n te gÿo lɔgɔ nyìŋ gẅie à tǒŋ lezíŋ sɔ́ɔn lé fʉ̀te, é gÿo tefʉ̀a wɔ́.
en: Do not misuse the name of the Lord your God, because the Lord will not leave anyone unpunished who misuses his name.

ngiemboon: Kímte lyɛʼɛ́ nzse Ssé, ńdɔg ńgÿo lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ ndʉalʉ̌a.
en: Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy:

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge láʼ lɔg melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ ntɔgɔ́, é pú faʼ mefàʼ mú.
en: You are to labor six days and do all your work,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, mbɔ́ɔntè lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, áa lyɛʼɛ́ nzse yɔ́ɔn, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù: Ɔ̀ te láʼ faʼa tsɔ́ fàʼ wɔ́, á gú, tà mbɔɔ míŋ gù wembàŋa kà wemanzwě wɔ́ɔ, kà ngàŋafàʼ gù wembàŋa kà wemanzwě wɔ́ɔ, kà menɔ̀ɔn pú wɔ́ɔ, kà pakÿoláʼ pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mí wɔ́ɔ.
en: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the Lord your God. You must not do any work #— #you, your son or daughter, your male or female servant, your livestock, or the resident alien who is within your city gates.

ngiemboon: Mélàʼmie mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, n da lɔg lyɛ̌ʼ ntɔgɔ́, ńgÿo lefaŋ pɔ́ tsetsáʼ, ńgÿo mí tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie áa tsoló, ńdeen ńké ńzẅɛte na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a. Áa mmó gie á la gÿo mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a n néŋ mbʉ́lè na lyɛʼɛ́ nzse, ńdɔg ńgÿo lyɛ̌ʼ gie áa yɔ́ɔn.
en: For the Lord made the heavens and the earth, the sea, and everything in them in six days; then he rested on the seventh day. Therefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath day and declared it holy.

ngiemboon: Ná mekùʼ tá gù pɔ́ má gù, tá à cʉa púʼu, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé jù, n kẅiʼi melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mú tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé jù, n nǎ né gù.
en: Honor your father and your mother   so that you may have a long life in the land that the Lord your God is giving you.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńzẅé nyìŋ.
en: Do not murder.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńgÿo gÿɛ́.
en: Do not commit adultery.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńjʉ.
en: Do not steal.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńtÿɔ́g sóon twó nyìŋ.
en: Do not give false testimony against your neighbor.

ngiemboon: Te láʼ ńdíe ndá nyìŋ ńtsɔ́ɔn; te láʼ ńdíe nzwě nyìŋ, ńtsɔ́ɔn, kà ngàŋafàʼ we wembàŋa, kà wemanzwě wɔ́ɔ, kà fòŋ we wɔ́ɔ, kà nzikáasè ye wɔ́ɔ, tà mbɔɔ kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie áa ye nyìŋ.
en: Do not covet your neighbor’s house. Do not covet your neighbor’s wife, his male or female servant, his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.

ngiemboon: Aláʼ ntsèm la ne ńgyá: lefaŋ ne ḿvɛ́te, ńŋwaŋa menně, ngyè ntaŋ ne ńcʉ́me, ndyé ne ńkẅɛɛ na lekwɛ́. Aláʼ la gyá; ńcÿɔʼ, ńne ḿvɛɛ, ńcʉ́ʼ ńtyé pɔ́ tàa nzèm.
en: All the people witnessed   the thunder and lightning, the sound of the ram’s horn, and the mountain surrounded by smoke. When the people saw it  # 20:18 Sam, LXX, Syr, Tg, Vg read smoke. The people (or they) were afraid, they trembled and stood at a distance.  # 20:18 Ex 19:18; Heb 12:18

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: «Kwàʼ gù gɔɔn nò né peg, peg zẅíʼte; táʼ, tà Ssé gɔɔn nò né peg, ḿbɔ́gɔ wég lékwéte.»
en: “You speak to us, and we will listen,” they said to Moses, “but don’t let God speak to us, or we will die.”

ngiemboon: Mǒonsê gɔɔn mbwó láʼ ngie: «Tà pi cÿɔʼ; e Ssé tǒ pɔ́ lélʉŋte gẅí; légwɔ́ gie pi pɔ́gɔ yé, à cʉa púʼu pi le gíŋe fʉa nò wɔ́.»
en: Moses responded to the people, “Don’t be afraid, for God has come to test you, so that you will fear him and will not   sin.”  # 20:20 Dt 13:3; Pr 16:6; Is 8:13

ngiemboon: Aláʼ la tyé ngʉ̀a shʉ̀shʉ̀a; táʼ, Mǒonsê tsóte nnɛ́ lé jʉʼ gie ssé melɔ̌ɔn laa wó, á gwɔ́ jʉʼ gie e Ssé laa wó.
en: And the people remained standing at a distance as Moses approached the total darkness where God was.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gɔɔn mbwó Mǒonsê ngie: «Ɔ̀ ge gÿo gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ngie: Pi la gyá páʼ n da fó lefaŋ, ńgɔɔn nò né pi.
en: Then the Lord told Moses, “This is what you are to say to the Israelites: You have seen that I have spoken to you from heaven.

ngiemboon: Pi těen ńdáʼa ńdɔgɔ nkáb kà pɔ́ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ wɔ́ɔ, ńnyɛte tsɔ̌ ssé, ńguʼte yɛ̌ ngie aa mèŋ wɔ́.
en: Do not make gods of silver to rival me; do not make gods of gold for yourselves.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gÿo lɔgɔ tsǎʼ, é pwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é náa mbwó mèŋ. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo gʉa na yɛ̌ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é nuŋe pwɔʼ gẅie mé tuɔ nɔ̀ɔn tà á pú shÿó pɔ́ ntsèm, mbɔɔ pwɔʼ gú we mbʉ́lè, mbɔɔ mvfó lâ menjʉ̀njÿò, ńgÿo mefòŋ. Nzɔ̌ɔ nzɔ̌ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie n ge láʼ nyɛ mbùm yɔ̀ɔn wó, n ge láʼ tó kẅɛ́te gú, é néŋ mbʉ́lè na gù.
en: “Make an earthen altar for me, and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, your flocks and herds. I will come to you and bless you in every place where I cause my name to be remembered.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn ne ńgee lɔg metǒon pwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ɔ̀ pɔ́ɔn lélɔg metǒon mie mé pagté pagte, mélàʼmie, ammó gie ɔ̀ ge lɔg pagte tóon, á ge néŋe lɔ̌ʼ mǒ, á le gíŋe ḿboŋo lélɔg ḿbwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ yɔ́ɔn mɔ́.
en: If you make a stone altar for me, do not build it out of cut stones. If you use your chisel on it, you will defile it.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ te láʼ pwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie mé kwɔ́ʼɔ pɔ́ mesetɔ̂b tá ńkúu jʉʼó wɔ́. À gwɔ́ púʼu, atsɔ̌ nyìŋ le fó tsìŋe ssé na sànzà, ńgyá jʉʼʉ shʉ́ nùŋepwɔʼ wɔ́.»
en: Do not go up to my altar on steps, so that your nakedness is not exposed on it.
